docs.snippet: The company behind the popular disappearing-message app Snapchat is offering three types of shares, and outsiders will get no voting rights.

headline.print_headline: Snap’s Plan Is Most Unfriendly to Outsiders
headline.main: Snap’s Plan Is Most Unfriendly to Outsiders

docs.snippet: The ride-sharing company lurches from scandal to scandal to scandal, and Apple is set to open a very round new office.

docs.snippet: The athletic gear company’s shares plunge as it reports the slowest revenue growth in years and its finance chief departs.

headline.print_headline: Making Under Armour Simple Takes Its Toll
headline.main: Making Under Armour Simple Takes Its Toll

docs.snippet: Tech companies, which have embraced globalization, reacted more forcefully to the president’s immigration order than counterparts in other industries.

headline.print_headline: Tech World Denounces Move to Bar Immigrants
headline.main: Silicon Valley’s Ambivalence Toward Trump Turns to Anger

docs.snippet: Oculus, a virtual reality company acquired by Facebook, is accused of stealing elements of the technology that went into its headsets.

headline.main: Mark Zuckerberg, in Suit, Testifies in Oculus Intellectual Property Trial

docs.snippet: Want to see how the other half live-tweets? The technology that insulated you will now free you.

docs.snippet: Could booking travel by text soon become the norm? Here are three chatbots that want you to book your trip with your smartphone.

headline.print_headline: Booking Travel, Minus the Human Touch
headline.main: How to Plan Your Next Vacation With a Chatbot

docs.snippet: A critical mass of our interactions has moved to a realm where we’re all connected but no one’s in charge.
Microsoft, Facebook, Google and Amazon used their PACs to support Republican Congressional candidates more than Democratic ones in 2016.

headline.print_headline: Silicon Valley Takes a Right Turn
headline.main: Silicon Valley Takes a Right Turn

docs.snippet: App stores backed by giant corporations have created choke points for the internet, which governments are now exploiting.

headline.print_headline: Censors Delight in the World’s Reliance on App Stores
